clinical_study.brief_title: Exploring the Effect of Combined Chinese and Western Treatment on Home Medical Care
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Combining Antihypertensive Drugs and Acupuncture on Isolated Systolic Hypertension of Elderly Patients at Home

brief_summary.textblock: combine antihypertensive drugs and acupuncture to isolated systolic hypertension elderly patients at home

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators would like to compare the effectiveness of acupuncture and drug therapy on blood pressure.
The investigators chose acupuncture point according the Traditional Chinese Medicine theory, besides, each patient was using 1-3 antihypertensive drug of a heterogeneous pharmacological group ranging from angiotensin-converting enzyme inhibitor (ACE inhibitor), diuretics, and beta blockers.

primary_outcome.time_frame: change from Baseline Systolic Blood Pressure at 3 months
primary_outcome.description: measure blood pressure after the treatment compare the initial blood pressure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: use the questionnaire at Baseline, 1.5 month, and three month later
secondary_outcome.description: use The Constitution in Chinese Medicine Questionnaire

secondary_outcome.time_frame: use ANS watch to monitor patient's condition at Baseline, 1.5 month, and three month later
secondary_outcome.description: use autonomic nervous system (ANS) watch to monitor patient's heart rate variability, Low Frequency/High Frequency ratio

arm_group.description: routine drug use, each patient was using 1-3 antihypertensive drug of a heterogeneous pharmacological group ranging from ACE inhibitors, diuretics, and beta blockers
routine drug use combine acupuncture twice a week for 3 months

intervention.description: antihypertension drug, acupuncture twice a week for 3 months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. patient with isolated blood pressure diagnosis by physicians and BP >140/<90 mmHg
2. patient took the drug to control blood pressure for more than one year
3. age>65 years old
4. Willing to participate in this study
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Suspected acute stroke
2. chest pain or dyspnea
3. ingestion of short-acting antihypertensive medication within 2 h prior to the beginning of the study
4. body temperature >37.5∘C(99.5∘F)

clinical_study.keyword: acupuncture, hypertension, elderly, home health care
